channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: After days of unrelenting downpours swelled rivers to near record levels across Kentucky, residents are closely monitoring waterways for signs they ar...

item.title: Stocks rebound on hopes Trump will negotiate tariff deals
item.description: The stock market is rebounding Tuesday after a three-day sell-off sparked by President Trump's tariffs.

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukrainian forces caught 2 Chinese men fighting for Russia

item.title: Iran says US talks to be 'indirect' despite Trump 'direct' negotiations announcement
item.description: Iranian officials confirmed Monday that Tehran would hold "indirect" high level talks with U.S. representatives in Oman this weekend.

item.title: Best loans for bad credit, plus expert advice on finding your best option
item.description: Having bad credit doesn't always mean it's impossible to get a loan. Here are some options to explore.

item.title: LIVE: ABC News Live
item.description: 24/7 coverage of breaking news and live events

item.title: Migrants who entered U.S. via Biden-era app stripped of legal status
item.description: Migrants who came to the U.S. via a Biden-era online appointment app​​ have been told to leave "immediately," officials say.

item.title: Trump tariffs live updates: Sec. Bessent tells ABC deals could come 'very quickly'
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Tuesday morning told ABC News he thinks deals can be made with other nations as some tariff negotiations begin.

item.title: Swollen rivers flood towns in the US South and Midwest
Trump admin tells prosecutors to ease up on crypto enforcement
item.description: The Trump administration is pulling back its enforcement of crypto regulations, disbanding a unit dedicated to cryptocurrency enforcement

item.title: Trump admin live updates: Trump cancels legal status for 900,000
item.description: The DHS revoked the parole status of those who used the CBP One App to obtain the status. The move puts over 900,000 migrants up for deportation.

item.title: For opioid victims, payouts fall short while governments reap millions
item.description: Pharmaceutical companies accused of fueling the nation's opioid crisis are paying state and local governments billions of dollars in legal settlements...

item.title: Colleges around the US say some international students’ visas are being revoked
